name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— using the correct and complete set of drawings
— all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, QMP, SWMS
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, QMP, SWMS
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure sign size and immage correspond with contract drawings and meets specification
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check for any services in proximity to points of installation or coring for spigots
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out work in accordance with drawings and in accordance with alignments, levels, grades, and sections.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The required positions of all posts and signs shall be as directed by the Superintendent who shall confirm the positions before the erection of posts commences.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sign to be installed as per most current drawings, local council documentation, and to the correct height and position.
○ Spigot embedment shall be within +/- 5mm of design horizontal position and +10mm of vertical design position
○ Signs specified to be re used are to comply with AS 1742 standards, and must be replaced if deemed in unsatisfactory condition
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:

REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers

1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out work in accordance with drawings and in accordance with alignments, levels, grades, and sections
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Painting/ application of material shall not commence unitll the Superintenent has inpsected the setout and given approval to proceed, unless an exemeption is granted.
○ Works shall be set out as required in clause 721.A03, that is: the dimensions and colour of pavement markings shall conform to the VicRoads Traffic Engineering Manual Volume 2.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Traffic Engineering Manual Volume 2, Yarra Trams Drawing STD_T9010,
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall comply with tolerances outlined whereby the outer edge of the tram track clearance line marking shall be offset by a distance as specified in IFC drawings from the running edge of the rail with a tolerance of +50 mm to -25 mm as per IFC drawings. The distance between the centreline of the marking and the centreline of the set out mark shall be <30 mm.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings VicRoads Sect 721 Table 721.A101(A)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall comply with the tolerances and positionings as outlined in Table 721.A101(B) when installing raised pavement markings.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— using the correct and complete set of drawings

REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers

1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to the first concrete pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Structural Concrete Design & Submission ITP completed and signed
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforcement schedule has been prepared for the reinforcement supply, to ensure that it achieves the specified tolerances on member dimensions, concrete cover and specified locations
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavations shall be to the depths shown on the drawings and that necessary to provide satisfactory foundation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Constructed in such a manner so it can be removed without damage to the concrete. Formwork/shoring shall be placed in locations where steel reinforcement and other fixtures can be inspected, and sufficiently tight at joints to prevent loss of slurry
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
3.1 Excavation/Foundation – Blinding, sealing or foundation concrete

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Blinding, sealing or foundation concrete shall not be placed until the bottom of the excavation has been reviewed by the Superintendent. Inspected and approved by the Superintendent.
○ Hold Point released by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A pre-pour survey carried out to confirm erected formwork within the tolerance. Any errors in the level or positioning of formwork is to be corrected prior to placing concrete
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In lapped splices, the bars shall be placed in contact and the specified cover shall be maintained.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall not be placed until all foreign material has been completely removed from the forms
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
3.5 Correct forms, reinforcements, rag bolt assembly and embedments
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Superintendent confirms that the inspected formwork, reinforcement, rag bolt assembly and embedments comply with the project drawings and specifications.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforcement and/or concrete shall not be placed until the proposed method of removing mud, loose rock or similar materials has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall not be place when temperature is <5°C or > 35°C
○ All steel components that are in contact with the concrete shall be cooled to below 32°C before concrete is placed
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sampling in accordance with 610.16
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Discharge time (concrete placed and compacted) < 90 minutes from batch time unless approved otherwise.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed. Accurate Site Notes & Load Mapping
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall be tansported, handled and placed in a manner that will prevent segregation or loss of materials
○ Concrete shall not be moved horizontally by vibrators
○ In continuous pours the max. time lag between truckloads on site is 25 minutes
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sufficient time shall be given for the concrete to cure prior to loading.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork shall be removed carefully and in such a manner as to avoid damage to the member or the concrete surfaces and maintain safety at all stages of removal. Formwork and formwork supports shall not be disturbed or adjusted during the concreting operation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
5.3 Positional tolerance and dimensions of concrete members and piles
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Dimensions within the tolerances given in Cl 17.5 of AS3600 (-10,+40)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Post Pour Checklist completed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete sampled and tested for Compressive Strength, and Slump.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Recorded of as-built drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
ITP-028 - Fencing and Furniture Installation
template name: ITP-028 - Fencing and Furniture Installation Rev2

name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are using the most current and updated set of complete construction drawings
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: EMP, SWMS & WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Confirm manufacturing process with supplier, fencing material shall be laser cut with clean finish, linished, pickled and electropolished
○ Welding shall be in accordance with AS1554
○ Ensure all components and fastenings are procured to the materials, sizes and grades specified in STD_T60003
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Confirm footings are set out to locations specified on design drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure fencing is isolated and earthed to achieve electrical isolation.
○ Lug shall be fitted to baseplate at specified fencing location
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall be of minimum strength N20
○ 4 M16 hot dipped galvanised bolts shall be chemset 175mm into embedment, per footing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Post shall be installed to designated height and level
○ Installed to footings with bolt assembly
○ All bolts shall be insulated from base plates, using non metallic sleeves and washers
○ The top of fence base plate shall be level with surrounding pavement
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Footing surface shall be cleaned and roughened before application
○ 50mm of Non shrink dry pack grout shall be placed under base plate
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 5mm cap plate on handrail returns
○ All sections to be welded as per AS 1554
○ All sharp edges and welds to be ground back to smooth finish
○ Domed buttons to be welded on top of handrail 150mm from the post centreline
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Architectural wire rope cables to be inserted into ferrel on fence post and to be tensioned with tamper proof fastenings (Loctite 243 Threadlock)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
ITP-036 - Kerb Access Ramp Bluestone Footpath
template name: ITP-036 - Kerb Access Ramp Bluestone Footpath Rev2

name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that employees and sub-contractors are using the most current and complete set of drawings
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Contract Drawings and Registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, including: EMP, TMP, SWMS and WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Care shall be taken in removing existing bluestone kerb
○ Detailed dilapidation survey shall be conducted, noting the size and quantity of pitchers before demolition of heritage bluestone
○ Bluestone shall be salvaged and re-used in new kerb alignment where possible
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Inspect delivered materials for any chips, cracks or other visible damage.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Line and level of reinstated bluestone kerbing shall be set out according to design levels.
○ Line and level of bluestone pavers, tactiles and inlay shall be set out according to design levels to suit new kerb heights.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
Construction of Access Ramp Bluestone Footpath
2.1 Re-levelling of bluestone kerbing and ramp
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bluestone kerbing to be re-installed to new design levels.
○ Bluestone kerb shall be placed on a bed of low slump, 20 Mpa concrete of 75mm minimum thickness.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings CoM Bluestone Paving Specification
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete base shall be inspected to be free of foreign materials and water pooling
○ After placing and vibration, the concrete shall be screeded and trowelled to the correct level.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: CoM Bluestone Paving Specification
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Mortar shall be applied at average thickness of 30mm to concrete base
○ All pavers shall be coated in mortar slurry on rear face before laying
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavers shall be cut with a diamond blade and allow a 10mm grout line at such points
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavers shall be placed in accordance with Dwg 1P50402.
○ Kerb access ramp wings shall be constructed at an angle and ramp gradient specified in IFC drawings
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Dwg 1P50402 Dwg 1P50201 IFC Drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavers shall have >24hrs curing time prior to light traffic
○ Where required, ply shall be laid over area of works
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavers shall be grouted using agreed colour and mixture
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.9 Installation of Versatac Granite Tactiles and Granite Inlay
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Tactiles and inlay shall be placed in accordance with Standard Drawing 1P50201.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavement area is free of debris and waste
○ Bluestone pavement is free of mortar stains and cleaned to satisfaction
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
